Job description

About the Company

Console Group is the market leader for providing websites, portals, CRM, property management and trust accounting solutions to over 4,000 real estate agencies throughout Australasia.

We are a passionate group of individuals who achieve and learn together. We have a unified vision and clear roadmap to achieving it. \xa0Our passionate and results orientated team is on a journey to help the real estate industry realise their true potential.


About The role


Our DevOps Engineers are responsible for implementing automation initiatives, dealing with software development and operations and Improving communication, calibration and integration between the development team and infrastructure.


What will you be working on?


  • Influencing design efforts for the secure and scalable environments that satisfy both operational and product needs.
  • Influencing and leading efforts and processes for continuous deployment cycles.
  • Driving resolution of issues identified via application and system monitoring. Resolving emergent service problems and building automated tools to identify/prevent problem recurrence.
  • Performing hands-on automation tasks to treat infrastructure as code.
  • Providing execution of activities related to infrastructure, security, continuous delivery, IT operations and metrics.
  • Communicating with key stakeholders on infrastructure and deployment details.
  • Leading code reviews
\xa0

To be successful, you will have


  • Tertiary qualification in an area of Information Technology and/or relevant experience

  • Experience in Amazon Web Services (AWS), Linux, Ansible, Docker and Scripting languages (bash, python, ruby)
  • Proven ability to identify problems and implement effective solutions
  • Experience in operating and monitoring a large system (microservice architecture)


Experience with mentoring junior DevOps Engineers and/or other development team members would be an advantage


What can we offer you?


  • Attractive remuneration package
  • A ‘Google Like’ office environment that allows you to excel in your field – we are a tech based software company and we mean it when we say it!
  • Fantastic team environment with a fun and friendly company culture. We have regular Super Mario Kart and Table Tennis competitions. We even have a regular Dungeons and Dragons team campaigns
  • A fully stocked kitchen and unlimited Nespresso coffee on tap
  • An office which is located a short 2 minute walk from Central train station


If you're keen to explore this opportunity then apply today by sending your resume!


Applicants must have Rights to Work in Australia\xa0

Merger & Acquisition Analyst | Lane Cove, NSW

Job description

Quality Manager (ANZ) | Lane Cove, NSW

Reference:\xa0XXXN-JO-1808-13391


  • Newly created permanent career opportunity based in Lane Cove
  • Active acuiqisition mandate
  • Free onsite parking and flexibility to work in our CBD office too

Bupa Dental Corporation is the leading, fastest growing dental services organisation in Australia and New Zealand. With a unique culture built on strong core values, we take great pride in producing quality work and recognising our employee strengths. We work alongside dental practices to unlock their potential allowing them to see rapid improvements in operational and business performances.

With a unique culture built on strong core values, we work alongside dental practices to unlock their potential allowing them to see rapid improvements in operational and business performances.


About the opportunity


The Merger and Acquisition (M&A) Analyst role will provide insightful financial analysis and reporting in preparation for and throughout M&A and commercial negotiations, in support of ongoing expansion and profitable operation of the business.


You will also need to be forward thinking in providing analytics that the business is yet to ask, focusing on mitigating risk and realising opportunities.


Key responsibilities include:

  • Ensuring that the proposed acquisition opportunity is aligned to broader corporate business objectives. This includes the analysis of customer demographics, the market structure and the opportunity within.
  • Preparing financial models to make an acquisition recommendation
  • Evaluating and producing business cases for potential acquisitions and major capital investments
  • Analysing business performance in support of management reporting
  • Providing support in commercial negotiations
  • Project managing the settlement of an acquisition. This includes the legal documentation, commercial settlement instructions and the communication of the transaction requirements to the relevant on boarding functions within Bupa.
  • Legal and regulatory compliance and adherence to internal operating procedures as applicable.


Your background


You will be driven by the opportunity to work with a global leader in health care that is on the path towards an exciting transformation.


  • A minimum of 1 to 3 years’ experience in a corporate finance role and will understand the finance deal process, display strong financial acumen
  • Excellent financial/quantitative analysis skills, with the ability to think strategically about the business and market opportunities.
  • Strong financial acumen, including extensive experience in building complex financial models and analysing outputs.
  • Demonstrated written and oral communication skills, with an ability to work effectively across all levels in the organisation.
  • Experienced and demonstrated experience with spreadsheets and intermediate/advanced level in word processing and presentation packages, specifically Excel, Word and PowerPoint
  • Proven ability to effectively manage multiple competing priorities and key stakeholders.


Join us:


Bupa believes in hiring the best talent in the market. We are known for our vibrant, high performing and incredibly rewarding and flexible workplace and we take pride in creating exceptional and meaningful work experiences and development opportunities. With a belief in innovation, we deliver award winning benefits to our employees and encourage involvement within our communities.


Bupa has everything – growth, passion, results and a caring and supportive culture that surrounds a burning ambition and purpose that is the best in the world.


If you have any questions regarding this vacancy or interested, please contact Charmian Kwan at ckwan@dentalcorp.com.au


No agencies. Only candidates with the right to work in Australia will be considered for this role.

Junior Optimisation and Personalisation Analyst

\xb7 Challenge yourself to ideate and manage compelling data-driven optimisation and personalisation activities

Few brands evoke the same feeling of pride that Qantas can. It’s a sense of familiarity, a feeling of warmth and confidence that his national icon represents us to the world. Every day, a committed team works together to ensure we’re continuing to exceed expectations.

As an organisation we set high expectations, but we know we can always do better. Our teams continue to look at how we drive productivity and decrease turnaround time to provide the best service and support possible.

The Optimisation and Personalisation Specialist ideates and manages compelling data-driven conversion activities including promotions and personalised optimisation content and/or functionality for web, mobile and emerging digital channels. Additionally, you will be responsible for managing complex data sets to identify and create hypothesis for action for Sales, Merchandising and Marketing teams. 884753491:
[

Registered Nurse, Enrolled Nurse (Medication Endorsed)

Company Name Bendigo Health Company Location Bendigo, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 1 view

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Bendigo Health

Bendigo Health is a leader in regional health care, combining outstanding services with a strong education, training and personal development culture. Bendigo is one of Victoria's fastest growing regional cities, our vision is " Excellent Care. Every Person. Every Time ."

Bendigo Health is a 700 bed service that treats more than 44,000 inpatients, triages more than 50,000 emergency attendees and welcomes more than 1,400 new born babies in a year. In addition more than 13,000 operations are performed in our operating theatres and more than 80,000 occasions of services are provided in our clinics to outpatients.

About Psychiatric Services

Bendigo Health’s Psychiatric Services Division provides a broad range of services to people with mental illness. Bendigo Health operates a 24 hour, seven days a week Psychiatric Regional Triage Service and has aligned services to support people who require crisis care. Psychiatric Services work with children and families, youth, adults and aged patients and provide care and support in community settings through clinical teams that are situated across the Loddon Mallee Region.

About Our Inpatient Services

Bendigo Health's Psychiatric Inpatient Services is made up for four Units: Psychiatry Extended Care, Psychiatry Adult, Psychiatry Older Persons and the Psychiatry Parent and Infant Unit.

Psychiatry Extended Care
Bendigo Health's Psychiatry Extended Care Unit is a 20 bed inpatient ward for persons aged 18-64 years experiencing unremitting and severe systems of mental illness along with associated and significant behavioural disturbance, while providing a secure environment for medium to long term treatment and rehabilitation.

Psychiatry Adult
Bendigo Health's Psychiatry Adult Unit provides intensive therapeutic treatment during an acute phase of mental illness for patients aged 16-64 years. Services are provided by a multidisciplinary team with support planned and delivered on the basis of the briefest appropriate duration of contact with the best patient outcomes. The unit has 26 low dependency and 9 high dependency beds.

Psychiatry Older Persons
Bendigo Health's Psychiatry Older Persons Unit provides inpatient treatment for persons typically aged 65 years and older with a mental illness and/or behaviours that cannot be safely managed in the community or by other aged care providers. Older Persons is a 20 bed acute inpatient ward supported by a multi-disciplinary team

Psychiatry Parent and Infant
Bendigo Health's Psychiatry Parent and Infant Unit is a 5 bed unit providing antenatal, postnatal and infant mental health assessment and management.

Our Opportunities

There are vacancies available for Registered and Endorsed Enrolled Nurses to join our Psychiatry Adult Acute team with ongoing opportunities to rotate through each of the Psychiatric inpatient units allowing employees to develop and enhance clinical skills in a broad range of environments.

Title: Registered Nurse, Enrolled Nurse (Medication Endorsed)
Department: Psychiatry Adult Acute
Classification: PE21 - YD22 NP21 - NP30
Salary: as per EBA
Status: Full time and Part time ongoing & Part time fixed term

For further information on the role please refer to the position description. Applications are to be submitted online.

Seniority Level

Associate

Industry

  • Medical Practice
  • Hospital & Health Care

Peerpoint: Senior Client Development Manager

Job description

About us



Peerpoint is a fast growing, entrepreneurial business that is looking for a Senior Client Development Manager with a 'can do' attitude to join the team and be part of this next phase of growth for the business in Asia Pacific.

Peerpoint is a global platform for legal talent, launched by A&O to offer clients a more innovative solution to support in-house skill gaps and capacity constraints.

Since its launch five years ago Peerpoint has experienced tremendous success that has seen it become one of the market leaders providing top-tier consultant lawyers to the leading financial institutions and corporates. 2018 is set to be our best year yet and with ambitions to launch in new markets, this is an exciting opportunity to be part of a fast growing and successful business that is redefining the market.

Peerpoint is a truly unique business that offers the opportunity to work in a dynamic, entrepreneurial and fun environment where you can have a direct impact on the success of the business but with the support, investment and benefits of a magic circle law firm.


Team focus


The Client Development team is a commercial team with a fantastic team spirit. We are looking for an intellectually curious, commercially astute and client focused individual to join us for this very exciting next phase in the business' growth. If you are excited by the prospect of working directly with Heads of Legal to help deliver resourcing solutions for their teams, if you like to see the impact of your work and enjoy working in a collaborative and team focused environment then we would love to hear from you!
The Client Development team is responsible for managing the end to end client sales process, which includes: sourcing and effectively qualifying new client leads; pitching to clients for business; establishing new and long-term client relationships; taking the client brief; sourcing suitable legal consultants; negotiating commercial terms; and closing the deal. It is a fast-moving process that requires an individual with drive, tenacity, strong organisational skills and excellent client management ability.






Your role and responsibilities

  • Identifying opportunities in the market and key accounts to pursue.
  • Leading meetings with key client contacts and developing strong relationships throughout the organisation.
  • Developing new business with new clients to drive growth.
  • Managing Head of Legal level relationships in a consultative, advisory and peer-to-peer capacity.
  • Effectively qualifying leads and new opportunities from existing and potential clients.
  • Taking comprehensive briefs from clients regarding their resourcing requirements.
  • Sourcing and 'matching' suitable candidates from our panel of consultant lawyers to your client engagements.
  • Running commercial negotiations with both clients and consultants.
  • Developing strategic account plans for the key accounts.
  • Close management and support of the consultants whilst they are on placement.
  • Acting as a champion and brand ambassador for Peerpoint externally in the market at industry events.



In return, we offer you:

  • A fun and dynamic environment to learn, develop and stretch yourself.
  • Dedication in supporting and empowering you to grow and progress in your career.
  • The chance to have direct client management for some of the most highly regarded global, regional and local brands and institutions.
  • A supportive team environment that recognises and rewards your commitment and success.
  • The opportunity to work with an inspiring and experienced senior management team to shape and develop the future of the business.
  • The chance to be part of a fantastic team culture - whether it's team charity walks, champagne tastings, or off sites in London, we work hard but also like to have fun together as a team.
  • Excellent benefits package

Job description

Cabrini

Cabrini is a Catholic charitable organisation inspired by the spirit and vision of Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini and the Missionary Sisters of the Sacred Heart of Jesus. This order was founded by Saint Frances Xavier Cabrini who was canonised in 1946 and later proclaimed Universal Patron Saint of Immigrants. We are a community of care, reaching out with compassion, integrity, courage and respect to all we serve. With more than 4300 staff, 1000 accredited medical practitioners and several locations, we offer a range of employment opportunities to start, continue or advance your career.

Allied Health

Allied Health, which represents twelve professions, is a rapidly growing and integrated service within Cabrini. Allied Health at Cabrini offers senior consultant and leadership roles; work in clinical streams; a junior staff rotation and support program; professional development and teaching opportunities; and developing strong external and university partnerships. There will be the expansion of collaborative, multi-disciplinary research with the recent appointment of a Senior Allied Health Research Consultant to support Allied Health led research.

The Role

Cabrini Prahran is a 22 bed inpatient palliative care unit that provides acute and intensive specialist palliative and end of life care. The senior physiotherapist is required to manage a clinical caseload of palliative patients as well as oversee operational management of palliative physiotherapy services as part of a multidisciplinary team. This may include palliative community home visits. The senior physiotherapist will provide clinical leadership to the junior palliative care physiotherapist and allied health assistant, and provide support to other members of the team as required. The senior physiotherapist will contribute to quality activities and education to ensure delivery of the highest quality, evidence-based palliative physiotherapy service. The senior physiotherapist will contribute to the physiotherapy student education program and will provide clinical supervision of physiotherapy students as required. We are looking for either a Grade 3 or Grade 2 Physiotherapist to take on this role. While this position is a part time role at 16 hours per week, there may be opportunity to extend these hours.

Key Capabilities
  • Physiotherapy degree as well as current registration with AHPRA
  • Excellent communication, organizational and prioritization skills
  • Drive and passion for continuous professional development
  • Evidence of strong team approach
  • Experience working in oncology / palliative care setting
  • Additional training in management of lymphoedema is desired, but not essential
  • Evidence of relevant postgraduate training is an advantage

Cabrini Offers
  • Salary Packaging
  • Professional development opportunities
  • Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
  • Close to public transportation

Cabrini is an equal opportunity employer

Cabrini is committed to providing a safe environment for children
